intro: Otostegia ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous otostegia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers display a mix of yellow and white petals. Otostegia ambigens is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators and its role in the unique flora of the region.
